main event: The airmen at Ellington AFB in Texas observed a bright, pulsating object moving across the sky on May 15, 1953.
interesting points: The object was first sighted at an angle of approximately 20 to 25 degrees from the horizon traveling in a north-northeast direction at a uniform rate of speed and altitude.
The object appeared to be about twice the apparent size of a star or planet and seemed to fluctuate or pulsate rather than emit a steady light.
The object faded from view in approximately 30 to 45 seconds as it moved across the sky.
Local flight service was unable to provide information to explain the object.
The report states that the object did not show any normal aircraft characteristics such as wings, tail surfaces, or exhaust.
sighted object: a bright, pulsating object in the sky
